Scottville Ky March 9/63
To his Excelency Governer Robinson

Your petitioners would respectfully represent that one James Loyd formerly a citizen of Allen County Ky. has been confine in the Penitentiary of Ky for something over seven years past his Sentence being for Ten years. We believe that Said Loyd is Innocent of the charge for which he was convicted and respectfully ask your Executive clemency in his behalf.

I A S Walker hereby certify that I was a witness in the case of James Loyd named in the above Petition and at the instance of the sd Loyd made an examination for recoginance of the by whom Loyd was of the crime of Rape. From the condition of all the genital parts I was & am still well satisfied that Loyd or no one else had ever had sexual intercourse with sd woman I consequently never have believed James Loyd guilty of the charge or crime of which he was convicted and believe his a just & proper case for the Executive Clemency
I have known Doct A. S. Walker as a practicing physician in this place for the past Thirty years and his statements may be implicitly relied on he being a Gentleman in every sense of the term

Allen Cir. Ct.
Pettn for Pardon of James Loyd of Allen County
"Rape"
The Pettn in this case is granted under a full conviction that said Lloyd was & is innocent of the offence for which he was convicted 7 April 1863

J F Robinson
10 years Penty
Issd Apr 9. 1863 --
